            <h1 class="c-article-magazine-title">US PhD admissions shrink as fears over Trump’s cuts take hold</h1>

                <div class="c-article-teaser-text">

    <script>
        if (window.config.mustardcut) {
            window.onload = function () {
                Array.prototype.slice.call(document.querySelectorAll(".magazine-infographic > iframe"))
                        .forEach(function (element) {
                            function listener(event) {
                                if (event.data.height) {
                                    if (element.id === event.data.requestData.id) {
                                        element.setAttribute("height", event.data.height)
                                    }
                                }
                            }

                            window.addEventListener("message", listener);
                            element.contentWindow.postMessage({name: "getHeight", id: element.id, articleId: "d41586-025-03417-6" }, "*");
                        });
            }
        }
    </script>

readabilityObject.title: US PhD admissions shrink as fears over Trump’s cuts take hold
readabilityObject.content:
• NEWS
  • 21 October 2025

Some doctoral programmes are admitting no students at all amid uncertainty about federal science funding.

By

  • Alexandra Witze
  1. Alexandra Witze

Phoenix-Avery Sarían has been interested in astronomy ever since her mother bought her a telescope as a child. But the fourth-year university student faces a cosmic challenge in reaching the next stage of her academic career: enrolling in a PhD programme.
